first_smile1.description: Let's hear it for Milo! He smiles now. This is one of his first.
first_smile1.title: First Smile 1

first_smile2.description: Milo quickly got the hang of this smile thing.
first_smile2.title: First Smile 2

natchez1.description: Dean and Felix actually missed the first smile;  they were in Natchez, visiting Nana and her mom, Granny.  That's the official name now: Granny.  Felix agrees and everything.  When we ask him where he went on the airplane, he says "Granny's!"
natchez1.title: Natchez 1

natchez2.description: Rocking and swining are favorite pastimes at Granny's.
natchez2.title: Natchez 2

natchez3.description: It was kind of cool for Natchez, though still hotter than it ever gets in San Francisco.
natchez3.title: Natchez 3

natchez4.description: Felix cools off by blowing bubbles.
natchez4.title: Natchez 4

natchez5.description: If Dean and Felix are going to take the gold in synchronized swimming, they're going to need to practice harder than this.
natchez5.title: Natchez 5

natchez7.description: Felix's first encounter with a sprinkler.
natchez7.title: Natchez 7

playdate.description: Playdate!  Evan and Janice come for trains and lunch.   Even though they are both very civil kids, they currently delight in annoying each other.  Such as both wanting to play on the exact same spot on a huge empty floor.  I'd like to say that they're practicing their conflict resolution skills in a safe environment, but they're not doing much resoluton.  They just start bawling.
playdate.title: Playdate

security-check.description: Since Felix has gotten back from Natchez, he's been playing airport a lot.  He's  quite realistic about it:  most of the time is spent waiting for the plane to be cleaned or refueled, or planes wait for their turn at the runway.  His control tower often tells the pilots just to wait, for no good reason.
security-check.title: Security Check

sling.description: The sling is our friend.  It makes Milo sleep.  Or at the very least muffles his cries.
sling.title: Sling

smelling.description: Felix, quite literally, likes to stop and smell the flowers.
smelling.title: Smelling

smile.description: By the end of the week, Milo was minting smiles left and right.  Give him a full tummy and a coo-ing person and the son would shine.
smile.title: Smile

smile6.description: ...and sometimes he just plain tries too hard.
smile6.title: Smile 6

totland1.description: Felix now regularly tricycles to the local playground.
totland1.title: Totland 1

description:
Milo smiled his first smile this week, and Dean and Felix went to Natchez.

Felix's language acquisition keeps taking interesting turns:

  • He's occasionally putting the diminutive "-ie" on the end of many words that don't really take it. A shoe might go on his "footie" and we could float a "boatie" in the bathtub.
  • In the space of a minute, in a conversation migrating from Enlish to French, he used the term "fireman" then "fire monsieur" then "pompier".
  • Even though he's never explicitly mentioned French or English, he's asked Dean to sing bedtime songs in Spanish. Fortunately Dean knows "Happy Birthday" and a Christmas carol in Spanish, and Felix seems content with those.
  • He's exploring the concept of "never been there/done that". When told that a plane was arriving from far away towns like Atlanta and Memphis, he solemnly says each time, "I NEVER been here!" (Meaning there.) He's taking it too far, though: he tried to tell Dean that "I NEVER read that!" to a book that Dean already read 8 times that day.
title: September 12
